titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Merrill W. Chase papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA150
titlestmt.author: C. Kopp and others

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-08-05 00:17:07 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvistsâ€™ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Merrill W. Chase papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: correspondence, reprints, manuscripts, slides, and notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Conference material, manuscripts, notices and memoranda, posters, printed matter, slides, correspondence, minutes, manuscripts, report, drafts, laboratory notes, clippings and reprints.

Box 1 consists primarily of materials collected or photographed by Dr. Chase during the student unrest of 1969 and 1970. A few earlier and later items are also included, as well as material from a conference on "Lead poisoning in children" held at the University on 25-26 March 1969.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials in Box 1 were transferred to the Rockefeller University Archives by Dr. Chase as a single group. Received or inventoried 1980 December 23.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted for a period of ten (10) years from the date of gift.

did.unittitle: Conference material: Lead poisoning in children, Rockefeller University, 25-26 March. 1969. Program, news releases, miscellaneous
Proposal: "Rockefeller University Student Proposals" Spring 1968; "Comments on Rockefeller University Student Proposal, " by Alfred E. Mirsky and Sonia Wohl, 15 May 1968
Talk: "Projections from the Past to the Future (or Present) " by Merrill W. Chase

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Including lists of slides, letter from F. Seitz, and two letters, from and to, David Rockefeller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Official notices and notices from Committee for a Democratic Society.

did.unittitle: Posters."E Pluribus Sickness" poster, with "Nine Lives Has a Cat". rhyme
The Newspaper, issued by Committee for a Democratic Society, Rockefeller University
(No vol. nos.) February 1972; May 1972 reprinted from March 1970 issue)
Slides: 48 slides showing posters, student marches

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Due to the oversize nature and potentially brittle condition of this material, special arrangements may be required in order to view materials. Individual items may be restricted due to preservation concerns.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Box 2 Arranged first by subject, then chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Box 2: Correspondence, minutes, manuscripts, reports, drafts, laboratory notes, clippings and reprints.

did.unittitle: Allergy Foundation of America. Expert Panel on Diagnostic Criteria for Allergic Disorders. Diseases include asthma and rhinitis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, minutes, questionnaires, reprints, notes.
Subjects: asthma, rhinitis.

did.unittitle: Enzyme detergents. American Academy of Allergy. Ad Hoc Committee on Enzymes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note by M.W. Chase, 22 May 1980: "The materials here represent the story of the American Academy of Allergy fighting the soap industry's introduction of bacterial proteolytic enzymes into washing powders. The upshot is that the industry withdrew the addition of enzymes".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, drafts of protocols, notes, manuscript of editorial published as "Sensitization to the enzymes in detergents" Lawrence M. Lichtenstein, I. Leonard Bernstein, Francis C. Lowell, Jordan N. Fink, David A. Levy, Solbert Permutt, Raymond G. Slavin, Sidney Les-kowitz, Merrill W. Chase, Jerry Dolovich, Journal of Allergy 47 (January 1971) 53-55. Also includes some correspondence with Federal Trade Commission, New York Academy of Sciences, and Proctor and Gamble.

did.unittitle: Published magazine and newspaper articles, reports, and manuscripts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, reprints.
See, for example, Paul Brodeur, "The Enigmatic Enzyme," The New Yorker, 16 January 1971.

did.unittitle: Slide: "Support the Judicial Committee,: with explanatory letter from Chase, 6 Jan 1981

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence. Photos.

did.unittitle: M.W. Chase. "Irreverent Recollections from Cooke and Coca 1928-1978" Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology 64 (November 1979) 306-320

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reprint.

did.unittitle: Merrill W. Chase, editor, Microbiology in New York City, The New York City Branch, The American Society for microbiologists

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reprint.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: "Ten Year Scroll, " re scroll presented to Simon Flexner in 1910 (Location of original unknown)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence. Photos. Photograph (B&W) of scroll.

did.unittitle: "The Early Days of the Hospital-by Homer F. Swift - Presented at Staff Rounds, Hospital of the R.I., April 30, 1952." Typescript, 23 pp., with pencil markings by George W. Corner, ca. 1960 and M.W. Chase letter, 18 June 1981

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence.

did.unittitle: RI Scientific Staff 1901-1919, graph, 1955, photographic print

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten description of graph by M.W. Chase of photo. "Constructed in 1955 by from STUDIES 10, vii, viii (1910) other records, with discrepancies eliminated by Hazel Olmstead, Secretary to Edric Smith Business Manager, who searched old records in vault of R.I.M.R.".
Photos. Photographic prints of graph; also 4x5 negative of graph.

scopecontent.p: Source: "Studies of The Rockefeller Institute 10, ix, x, xi (1910)". (List of names).

Table assignments, Dinner for Long-Service employees
Invitation to Buffet Dinner Dance to celebrate the Twentieth Anniversary of the Faculty and Students Club

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: This file was removed from the M.W. Chase papers and inserted into the Theobald Smith papers. See Archivist for assistance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: See: Dolman, "Theobald Smith and His Presidential Address to the Society of American Bacteriologists [1903]" pp. 231-235. [added to Theobald Smith file archives].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence. Includes:.
"Minutes of the Special Session on Radiation. Effects on Infection and Immunity." Duplicated typescript, 7 pp.
"Progress report, December 1958, on properidin, with Chase/D.M. Pillsbury, 16 Feb 1959, comments. Chase holograph notes of annual meeting, 24, 25 Mar 1959, Commission on Immunization.

"Annual Report of the Commission on Cutaneous Diseases of the AFEB, 1 May 1959-30 Apr 1960," with attached reports of Investigators Harvey Blank, Herman N. Eisen, Abraham G. Osler, Thomas H. Sternberg and Earl G. McNall, Donald M. Pillsbury.

did.unittitle: St. Jude Hospital (Memphis, Tenn.) [Scientific Advisory Board]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence. primarily with Donald F. Pinkel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence. includes grant applications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grant application.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes memoranda, reports and report drafts, minutes of meetings.

did.unittitle: "Progress Report to the Scientific Advisory Board, March 1964"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notes on Scientific Advisory Board meetings by investigators at St. Jude Hospital.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence.
Correspondents include: Daniel Borgen, Arthur Cherkin, r.k. Richards barren M. Cox, Jr., Howard C. Hopps, Robert A. Harte.

Chase/Daniel Borgen, 4 Dec 1947, "I am writing to you as co-chairman of a subcommittee on Antigenicity having to do with Protein Hydrolysate Injection under the auspices Df U.S.P. Revision Committee...".
"A.D.M.A.-A.P.M.A. Subcommittee on Amino Acids. Report to U.S.P. Amino Acids Advisory Committee" 20 Nov 1947, Philadelphia, PA.
"Fourth draft. Antigenicity, tentative standard for." 1 p., undated.
Robert C. Anderson et al., "Some Pharmacologic Tests on 'Supprotein' (Protein Hydrolysate, Lilly), 6%." 6 pp., typescript carbon, undated.
R.A. Harte/Chase, 6 Nov 1946, enc "copies of excerpts of previous bulletins and memoranda from Dr. Cook's Office" re antigenicity tests for protein hydrolysate preparation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondents include Robert A. Harte, Arthur Cherkin, Charles F. Kade, Jr., Melville Sahyun, H.B. Devlin, R.A. Brown, E.M. Nelson, E. Fullerton Cook.

Correspondence. E. Fullerton Cook/Chase, 18 Oct 1946, inviting Chase to assis in drafting of an "Antigenicity of Protein Hydrolysate Injection" for Committee of Revision of the Pharmacopoeia of the United State of America 1940-1950.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondents include K.K. Chen K.S. Pilcher, Howard C. Hopps, George W. Thorn, Warren M. Cox, Jr.
Correspondence. Chase/George Thorn, 12 Jun 1947 re anaphylaxis tests and Thorn remarks at the "Conference at Philadelphia in February".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondents include Arthur Cherkin, L.W. Roth, D.V. Frost, R.K. Richards, Warren M. Cox, Jr.

did.unittitle: Minutes of meetings and other duplicated material of the U.S.P. Amino Acids Advisory Committee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts of Chase memorandum on "Antigenicity of Protein Hydrolysate Injection".
Technical data and reports.

did.unittitle: RenÃ© Dubos, Holograph manuscript review of Resistance to Tuberculosis: Experimental Studies in Native and Acquired Defensive Mechanisms, by Max B. Lurie (Harvard University Press, 1965). Review published in American Review of Respiratory Diseases 92 (1965) 500-1. Photocopy of review added to folder. [This manuscript was given to Dr. Chase's wife by Dr. Clara Lynch before Dr. Lynch]
F.R. Sabin et al., "A study of the toxic properties of tuberculoproteins and polysaccharides, " J. Exp. Med. 53 (1 Jan 1931) 51-80
K.C. Smithburn, "The standardization of longevity against dose in experimental tuberculosis...," J. Exp. Med. 64 (1 Nov 1936) 771-790

K.C. Smithburn, "Virulence of bovine tubercule bacilli"; K.C. Smithburn, "Histopathology of experimental tuberculosis", K.C. Smith-burn et al., "Haematological studies..". Amer. Rev. Tuberc. 36 (Nov 1937) 637-691

F.R. Sabin et al., "Cellular reactions to polysaccharides from tubercule bacilli..". J. Exp. Med. 68 (1 Oct 1938) 563-582 / F.R. Sabin and A.L. Joyner, "Tubercular allergy without infection," J. Exp. Med. 68 (1 Nov 1938) 659-676 /K.C. Smith-burn and F.R. Sabin, "Reactions of normal and tuberculous animals..". J. Exp. Med. 68 (1 Nov 1938) 641-658. [The last two reprints have markings]
A. Claude and J.B. Murphy, "Transmissible tumors of the fowl," Physiol. Revs. 13 (Apr 1933) 246-275
A. Claude, "Properties of the causative agent of a chicken tumor. X and XI". J. Exp. Med. 61 (1 Jan 1935) 27-40, 41-57
A. Claude and A. Rothen, ibid. XII..". Amer. J. Cancer, 26 (Feb 1936) 344-350
A. Claude, "A Fraction from normal chicken embryo..". Proc. Soc. Exp. Biol. Med. 39 (1938) 398-403
"Presentation of Robert Barry Bloom for the Degree of Ph. D. June 12, 1963 (Final version for 4. 5 minute presentation). Merrill W. Chase"
"Transfer Factor and the Chase Laboratory." [Merrill W. Chase, 1982]
"The Immunological Enigma of Transfer Factor. Merrill W. Chase"
M.W. Chase/C. Kopp, 22 Nov 1983 re 1st Transfer Factor Workshop 1973; includes Christmas/holiday cards
Cards from Esther Cohn (mother of Zanvil Cohn)
P.J. Dragsted family (of R Dubos lab)
Hal Simon family (of R. Dubos laboratory)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Slides made for M.W. Chase in 1955, and slides used by Dr. Homer F. Swift at a Hospital Staff Rounds; among the Swift slides are some which clearly were made for his lecture with his name, and others which were probably made a long time previously and perhaps used by him in some prior talk."--Merrill W. Chase, 1982 June 24

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 83 pictures taken by Merrill W. Chase or his wife Cynthia, in the years 1973, 1974, 1975, 1976 and 1979 at the Annual Dinner for Retirees.
Also included are six color-coded lists which identify the persons shown.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented to the RU archives by Merrill W. Chase, June 9, 1981.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Due to the oversize nature and potentially brittle condition of this material, special arrangements may be required in order to view materials. Individual items may be restricted due to preservation concerns.
